verses.verse: Ye are the children<WH1121> of the LORD<WH3068> your God<WH430>: ye shall not cut<WH1413> yourselves, nor make<WH7760> any baldness<WH7144> between your eyes<WH5869> for the dead<WH4191>.

For thou art an holy<WH6918> people<WH5971> unto the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430>, and the LORD<WH3068> hath chosen<WH977> thee to be a peculiar<WH5459> people<WH5971> unto himself, above all the nations<WH5971> that are upon<WH6440> the earth<WH127>.
Thou shalt not eat<WH398> any abominable thing<WH8441>.
These are the beasts<WH929> which ye shall eat<WH398>: the ox<WH7794>, the sheep<WH7716> <WH3775>, and the goat<WH5795>,
The hart<WH354>, and the roebuck<WH6643>, and the fallow deer<WH3180>, and the wild goat<WH689>, and the pygarg<WH1788>, and the wild ox<WH8377>, and the chamois<WH2169>.

And every beast<WH929> that parteth<WH6536> the hoof<WH6541>, and cleaveth<WH8157> the cleft<WH8156> into two<WH8147> claws<WH6541>, and cheweth<WH5927> the cud<WH1625> among the beasts<WH929>, that ye shall eat<WH398>.

Nevertheless these ye shall not eat<WH398> of them that chew<WH5927> the cud<WH1625>, or of them that divide<WH6536> the cloven<WH8156> hoof<WH6541>; as the camel<WH1581>, and the hare<WH768>, and the coney<WH8227>: for they chew<WH5927> the cud<WH1625>, but divide<WH6536> not the hoof<WH6541>; therefore they are unclean<WH2931> unto you.

And the swine<WH2386>, because it divideth<WH6536> the hoof<WH6541>, yet cheweth not the cud<WH1625>, it is unclean<WH2931> unto you: ye shall not eat<WH398> of their flesh<WH1320>, nor touch<WH5060> their dead carcase<WH5038>.
These ye shall eat<WH398> of all that are in the waters<WH4325>: all that have fins<WH5579> and scales<WH7193> shall ye eat<WH398>:
And whatsoever hath not fins<WH5579> and scales<WH7193> ye may not eat<WH398>; it is unclean<WH2931> unto you.
Of all clean<WH2889> birds<WH6833> ye shall eat<WH398>.
But these are they of which ye shall not eat<WH398>: the eagle<WH5404>, and the ossifrage<WH6538>, and the ospray<WH5822>,
And the glede<WH7201>, and the kite<WH344>, and the vulture<WH1772> after his kind<WH4327>,
And every raven<WH6158> after his kind<WH4327>,
And the owl<WH1323> <WH3284>, and the night hawk<WH8464>, and the cuckow<WH7828>, and the hawk<WH5322> after his kind<WH4327>,
The little owl<WH3563>, and the great owl<WH3244>, and the swan<WH8580>,
And the pelican<WH6893>, and the gier eagle<WH7360>, and the cormorant<WH7994>,
And the stork<WH2624>, and the heron<WH601> after her kind<WH4327>, and the lapwing<WH1744>, and the bat<WH5847>.
And every creeping thing<WH8318> that flieth<WH5775> is unclean<WH2931> unto you: they shall not be eaten<WH398>.
But of all clean<WH2889> fowls<WH5775> ye may eat<WH398>.

Ye shall not eat<WH398> of any thing that dieth of itself<WH5038>: thou shalt give<WH5414> it unto the stranger<WH1616> that is in thy gates<WH8179>, that he may eat<WH398> it; or thou mayest sell<WH4376> it unto an alien<WH5237>: for thou art an holy<WH6918> people<WH5971> unto the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430>. Thou shalt not seethe<WH1310> a kid<WH1423> in his mother's<WH517> milk<WH2461>.
Thou shalt truly<WH6237> tithe<WH6237> all the increase<WH8393> of thy seed<WH2233>, that the field<WH7704> bringeth forth<WH3318> year<WH8141> by year<WH8141>.

And thou shalt eat<WH398> before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430>, in the place<WH4725> which he shall choose<WH977> to place<WH7931> his name<WH8034> there, the tithe<WH4643> of thy corn<WH1715>, of thy wine<WH8492>, and of thine oil<WH3323>, and the firstlings<WH1062> of thy herds<WH1241> and of thy flocks<WH6629>; that thou mayest learn<WH3925> to fear<WH3372> the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> always<WH3117>.

And if the way<WH1870> be too long<WH7235> for thee, so that<WH3588> thou art not able<WH3201> to carry<WH5375> it; or if the place<WH4725> be too far<WH7368> from thee, which the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> shall choose<WH977> to set<WH7760> his name<WH8034> there, when the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> hath blessed<WH1288> thee:

Then shalt thou turn<WH5414> it into money<WH3701>, and bind up<WH6696> the money<WH3701> in thine hand<WH3027>, and shalt go<WH1980> unto the place<WH4725> which the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> shall choose<WH977>:

And thou shalt bestow<WH5414> that money<WH3701> for whatsoever thy soul<WH5315> lusteth after<WH183>, for oxen<WH1241>, or for sheep<WH6629>, or for wine<WH3196>, or for strong drink<WH7941>, or for whatsoever thy soul<WH5315> desireth<WH7592>: and thou shalt eat<WH398> there before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430>, and thou shalt rejoice<WH8055>, thou, and thine household<WH1004>, desireth: Heb. asketh of thee
And the Levite<WH3881> that is within thy gates<WH8179>; thou shalt not forsake<WH5800> him; for he hath no part<WH2506> nor inheritance<WH5159> with thee.

At the end<WH7097> of three<WH7969> years<WH8141> thou shalt bring forth<WH3318> all the tithe<WH4643> of thine increase<WH8393> the same year<WH8141>, and shalt lay it up<WH3240> within thy gates<WH8179>:

And the Levite<WH3881>, (because he hath no part<WH2506> nor inheritance<WH5159> with thee,) and the stranger<WH1616>, and the fatherless<WH3490>, and the widow<WH490>, which are within thy gates<WH8179>, shall come<WH935>, and shall eat<WH398> and be satisfied<WH7646>; that the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> may bless<WH1288> thee in all the work<WH4639> of thine hand<WH3027> which thou doest<WH6213>.
